skillTree.localised_description: The King carries his enormous Oath Stone everywhere. In dire times, he stands tauntingly atop it to fight to the end.

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

skillTree.localised_description: Bring me closer, I didn't hit that one yet!

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit's vigour is less affected by fatiguing actions, such as combat.
This unit can fire while on the move.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: To fire the forges and bring true craft and artifice back into the world.
All Dwarfs are stubborn, but none more so than Grudgebearer, the founder of the Age of Reckoning.
"I'm not afraid of you - my beloved Ancestors are older and wiser than your dark, uncaring deities!"

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This stubborn Dwarf refuses to yield or tire, and ensures his followers are of the same ilk.
The endless courage of the Warrior God, directed to bolster this Dawi’s own reserves.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Carried by grim determination, the King's bodyguards will not be found wanting.

effects.description:
Recruitment and Upkeep cost: -15% for Huskarls
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The tales of Thorgard's bravery and the ruinous grudges marked on their families' books will push each Thane and lordling to even greater efforts.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +5% for Lords and embedded Heroes
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: As battle frenzy descends upon the King and his closest warriors, the entire throng follows, a daring warcry shaking the mountains.
The Great King is a stalwart warrior and ruler, but his is the blood of the Dordegruden, a clan forged in honour yet quick and terrible in its anger when roused.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +1 for Thanes
	(all provinces)

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Rage" for Dwarf Lords and Thanes
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: In honour of the many fallen of Kraka Drak and of his predecessor slain by Valmir Aesling, Thorgard will never rest, never hesitate as long as there are Norscans to punish.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +5% when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca
	(all armies)

Leadership: +8 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Norsca and Daemons of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These armour plates have been girded with runes to ensure the wearer is protected from all manner of attacks.
Dawi of distinction tend to have the best weapons, whether made specially for them or taken as spoils from their defeated foes.
This Lord's ability to withstand prolonged combat and show fortitude has a positive effect on those fighting nearby.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Dwarfs are resolute - once they commit to charging the foe, they put all their strength behind that initial blow.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Raiders, Warriors of the Ruinous Powers, Daemons. After generations of struggle, the seething hatred against these foes has grown in an Ancestral Grudge.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +20% when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Skaven

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
Dwarfs are not fast, yet they will soldier on, always moving despite any hazards encountered.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The next thing I'm gonna hear from yer, Umgi, is 'I'm sorry, Master Dwarf, we were thoroughly lost'. That, or the sound of me axe splitting yer skull."

skillTree.localised_description: This is yer ax! You shall kill with it! You shall work with it! You shall sleep with it! And then you shall kill some more!

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord knows his throng thrives in ranged combat and expects his Clansdwarfs to excel in that discipline.

skillTree.localised_description: Glittering in runes, the elite of Kraka Drak is an inexorable force.

skillTree.localised_description: Although missile weapons do not have a strong appeal to any true son of Kraka Drak, some have mastered the art of shooting large beasts dead with anything they were wielding.

Missile strength: +6% for Bolt Throwers, Grudge Throwers, Trollsearers, Frostdrakes and Spikegunners

skillTree.localised_description: Interlocking shields, dirty and astute tricks, even human allies are all cards to the smart Lord deck.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
In the warlike north, the shieldwall attacks back.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: +15% for shielded units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10 for shielded units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There is nothing more irritating than a foe beyond axe distance.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for dual-wielding units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for dual-wielding units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A large axe is solid and reliable. You only live once.

effects.description:
Bonus vs. Large: +5 for two-handed units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for two-handed units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
A patrol here, a falling rock there, and the enemy's day is ruined. Forever.
Get the wretches! Kill 'em! Maim 'em! Burn 'em! In whichev'r order!
A Dwarf with a fine beard is as Dawi as they come.
Lords close to the powerful Masons' Guild will get discounts for labour and materials.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -2% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
	(local region)

Construction cost: -5% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
	(local region)

Construction cost: -9% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Such a Dawi does not care for being wounded - by his will alone he continues to fight.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "All Dwarfs to me! We have grudges to settle - Grimnir demands it!"
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: A wise Lord will gather Engineers to his service, ensuring the Dwarfs maintain their technological edge.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

factionEffects.localised_description: Despite his unwavering resistance against Chaos, Thorgard Cromson may end up being the last Great King of Kraka Drak.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Lords and embedded Heroes

items.colour_text: Crafted in solid blocks of local blue amber, framed in gromril, this marvelous runic armour is said to be eternally polished and preserved by the Winds.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: -15
	(local region)

items.colour_text: An ancient axe exclusive to the legitimate King of Kraka Drak, baptized in dragon blood and sharpened on Kurgan skulls.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: An ancient axe exclusive to the legitimate King of Kraka Drak, baptized in dragon blood and sharpened on Kurgan skulls.
No matter how grievous his wounds, the King of Kraka Drak cannot be detained from his duties for long.
